abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, with a likely sustainability. Nonetheless, key
            lessons suggest that, although broad, and complex projects
            do provide an opportunity to learn, while supporting the
            borrower's comprehensive programs, it limits the
            opportunity of significant Bank's contribution to
            physical, and institutional improvement. Furthermore,
            institutional development may be hindered by the exclusive
            focus on form, and structure, whereas broader governance,
            focusing on policies, and performance should be addressed.
            For instance, industrial pollution can be better addressed
            through strict market-based financing, focusing on
            commercial viability, strong regulations, and, a limited
            public assistance to channel solely pollution control, for
            the low increases in management efficiency of district
            heating, energy, and pollution control, indicate the
            desirability of smaller market-based systems. Finally, it is
            suggested that in order to maximize the value of large-scale
            studies, clear policy motivation, and an institutional
            basis, are essential factors to support this value.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project objective is to assist
            Beijing Municipality to plan cost-effective strategies for a
            comprehensive environmental protection program, strengthen
            the policy and institutional framework required, and support
            priority investments needed to start the process.  The
            project will address pollution problems associated with air
            and water quality, and the disposal of domestic and
            industrial solid wastes.  The physical works include: (a)
            the construction of sewer networks to prevent pollution of
            groundwater and the city's waterways; (b) the
            construction of a pressurized hot water piping system for
            district heating to alleviate air pollution from the burning
            of coal at domestic residences; (c) renovation of a number
            of highly polluting industries, and, in some cases,
            relocation of these industries from the inner city area; and
            (d) construction of a sanitary landfill and procurement of
            equipment for municipal solid waste disposal.  Technical
            assistance will be included for studies to develop cost
            effective plans which consider collectively the
            environmental goals and resource needs between the various
            economic and service sectors in order to arrive at an
            optimal solution that can be sustained by the municipality.
            A training component will be included to help improve the
            environmental management capability of key staff of the
            Environmental Protection Bureau and institutions providing
            urban environmental services.
